Hollywood Singing And Dancing
programme.desc: Hollywood Singing and Dancing: A Musical History: Directed by Mark McLaughlin. With Obba Babatundé, John Badham, Robert S. Birchard, Nikki Blonsky. A look at the history of musical movies hosted by Shirley Jones. programme.title: A Different Loyalty
Druga odanost
programme.desc:
A Different Loyalty: Directed by Marek Kanievska. With Sharon Stone, Rupert Everett, Julian Wadham, Michael Cochrane. British war reporter Leo and American journalist Sally meet on assignment in Beirut. When Leo disappears, Sally begins to uncover his secret life, which leads her behind the Iron Curtain and into the clutches of the KGB. In HD." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0326828/","name":"A Different Loyalty","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNjg1OTVhMzItZjAzYi00Y2E1LTlhNTMtMTU3OTNkNDAwZjk2XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTQxNzMzNDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"British war reporter Leo and American journalist Sally meet on assignment in Beirut. When Leo disappears, Sally begins to uncover his secret life, which leads her behind the Iron Curtain and into the clutches of the KGB. In HD.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0326828/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"kostu-san"},"dateCreated":"2004-08-18","inLanguage":"English","name":"Avoid..","reviewBody":"Watching this movie was a very disappointing experience. The premise was good (like with most movies out there), but the execution was just atrocious, and the story was unrealistic at best. For example, the movie shows us that a westerner was allowed to go in and out of Soviet Union, as well as go though streets of Moscow without any surveillance in the midst of cold war!!

Moreover, the actors seemed like they were made out of wood in terms of expressiveness. The story was painfully slow and was heading nowhere, really: nothing changed nor happened though the entire movie...

Funny how our protagonists had a view at the Basilica of Christ the Saviour in early 70s (Destroyed in early 20th century, restored in late 90s by the mayor of Moscow)... This and many other anachronisms give out the fact that the production team didn't even research the subject of their work before filming...

2/10","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":2}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":1444,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Drama","Romance","Thriller"],"datePublished":"2004-10-14","keywords":"flashback,spy,father son relationship,treason,englishman abroad","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"A Different Loyalty","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2075394329","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzEwNWUzYWUtNDhjOC00MTAwLThkOTYtMDZlOGNhMWQxZGE1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzEwNWUzYWUtNDhjOC00MTAwLThkOTYtMDZlOGNhMWQxZGE1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Home Video Trailer from Artisan"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000232/","name":"Sharon Stone"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000391/","name":"Rupert Everett"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0905554/","name":"Julian Wadham"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0437709/","name":"Marek Kanievska"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0060306/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0126277/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0104832/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0682063/","name":"Jim Piddock"}],"duration":"PT1H36M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Waking Up in Reno
Tajna afera
programme.desc: Waking Up in Reno: Directed by Jordan Brady. With Natasha Richardson, Holmes Osborne, Billy Bob Thornton, Patrick Swayze. A romantic comedy about two trashy couples travelling to Reno to see a monster truck show." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0219400/","name":"Waking Up in Reno","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOTMxNjI1ZWEtODIwZC00NmM3LTkwNWEtYjdkY2IyODQxNGI5XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTQ4NDY5OTc@._V1_.jpg","description":"A romantic comedy about two trashy couples travelling to Reno to see a monster truck show.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0219400/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"hokeybutt"},"dateCreated":"2005-04-02","inLanguage":"English","name":""She's On Her Deal, Y'Know?"","reviewBody":"WAKING UP IN RENO (3 outta 5 stars) Dubbed by the filmmakers as "a redneck 'Bob and Carol and Ted and Alice'", this is an enjoyable little movie... very funny at times but also treating its characters as real people with real emotions. Billy Bob Thornton is Lonnie Earl, a used car salesman married to Darlene (Natasha Richardson) but who has had a recent fling with her best friend Candy (Charlize Theron). Candy's husband Roy (Patrick Swayze) is desperately trying to get his wife pregnant but suspects his sperm may not be working. While on a vacation in Reno to renew their wedding vows, the foursome's relationship comes to a head when Roy's non-existent sperm count is confirmed the same day as his wife's pregnancy and everyone notices Lonnie Earl's shifty eyes upon hearing the news. While amusing and likable, the movie isn't quite as good as it could have been... and it often seems to be setting up future situations (like a suddenly-ignored attraction between Roy and Darlene) that never come to fruition. (I was expecting much hilarity from a scene of Lonnie Earl's attempt at eating a 72 ounce steak in one hour... but the scene winds up being mostly uneventful.) The actors do a great job though... particularly Thornton, whose skill at blurting out totally insensitive and inappropriate lines is unsurpassed, i.e. "She's on her deal, y'know?" And I will take any excuse to see the lovely Mrs. Liam Neeson (Natasha Richardson) on screen!","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":6}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":5905,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.5},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Comedy","Romance"],"datePublished":"2002-12-13","keywords":"girlfight,catfight,reference to priscilla presley,reference to elvis presley,reference to loni anderson","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Waking Up In Reno","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3234897433","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOGE3YzkzMjgtMDk1Ni00NjY5LWI4ZTEtZGJhMDgwYzFkODA2XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOGE3YzkzMjgtMDk1Ni00NjY5LWI4ZTEtZGJhMDgwYzFkODA2XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Trailer for Waking Up In Reno"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000671/","name":"Billy Bob Thornton"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000234/","name":"Charlize Theron"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000664/","name":"Patrick Swayze"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0103655/","name":"Jordan Brady"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0021526/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0022594/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0109785/","name":"Brent Briscoe"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0269226/","name":"Mark Fauser"}],"duration":"PT1H31M"}</script><metacontent="

IMDb data; ttnr: 0219400, Title: Waking Up in Reno, --- Description: Waking Up in Reno: Directed by Jordan Brady. With Natasha Richardson, Holmes Osborne, Billy Bob Thornton, Patrick Swayze. A romantic comedy about two trashy couples travelling to Reno to see a monster truck show." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0219400/","name":"Waking Up in Reno","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOTMxNjI1ZWEtODIwZC00NmM3LTkwNWEtYjdkY2IyODQxNGI5XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTQ4NDY5OTc@._V1_.jpg","description":"A romantic comedy about two trashy couples travelling to Reno to see a monster truck show.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0219400/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"hokeybutt","dateCreated":"2005-04-02","inLanguage":"English","name":""She's On Her Deal, Y'Know?"","reviewBody":"WAKING UP IN RENO (3 outta 5 stars) Dubbed by the filmmakers as "a redneck 'Bob and Carol and Ted and Alice'", this is an enjoyable little movie... very funny at times but also treating its characters as real people with real emotions. Billy Bob Thornton is Lonnie Earl, a used car salesman married to Darlene (Natasha Richardson) but who has had a recent fling with her best friend Candy (Charlize Theron). Candy's husband Roy (Patrick Swayze) is desperately trying to get his wife pregnant but suspects his sperm may not be working. While on a vacation in Reno to renew their wedding vows, the foursome's relationship comes to a head when Roy's non-existent sperm count is confirmed the same day as his wife's pregnancy and everyone notices Lonnie Earl's shifty eyes upon hearing the news. While amusing and likable, the movie isn't quite as good as it could have been... and it often seems to be setting up future situations (like a suddenly-ignored attraction between Roy and Darlene) that never come to fruition. (I was expecting much hilarity from a scene of Lonnie Earl's attempt at eating a 72 ounce steak in one hour... but the scene winds up being mostly uneventful.) The actors do a great job though... particularly Thornton, whose skill at blurting out totally insensitive and inappropriate lines is unsurpassed, i.e. "She's on her deal, y'know?" And I will take any excuse to see the lovely Mrs. Liam Neeson (Natasha Richardson) on screen!","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":6,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":5905,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.5,"contentRating":"R","genre":["Comedy","Romance"],"datePublished":"2002-12-13","keywords":"girlfight,catfight,reference to priscilla presley,reference to elvis presley,reference to loni anderson","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Waking Up In Reno","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3234897433","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOGE3YzkzMjgtMDk1Ni00NjY5LWI4ZTEtZGJhMDgwYzFkODA2XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOGE3YzkzMjgtMDk1Ni00NjY5LWI4ZTEtZGJhMDgwYzFkODA2XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Trailer for Waking Up In Reno","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000671/","name":"Billy Bob Thornton","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000234/","name":"Charlize Theron","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000664/","name":"Patrick Swayze"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0103655/","name":"Jordan Brady"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0021526/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0022594/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0109785/","name":"Brent Briscoe","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0269226/","name":"Mark Fauser"],"duration":"PT1H31M"</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Sydney White
Super luzeri
programme.desc:
Sydney White: Directed by Joe Nussbaum. With Amanda Bynes, Sara Paxton, Matt Long, Jack Carpenter. A modern retelling of Snow White set against students in their freshman year of college in the greek system." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0815244/","name":"Sydney White","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTk3ODc3ODAxN15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNzcwMDU1MQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A modern retelling of Snow White set against students in their freshman year of college in the greek system.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0815244/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"mollymormonbrat"},"dateCreated":"2007-09-22","inLanguage":"English","name":"Not the most original, but sweet, harmless and entertaining!","reviewBody":"Maybe I just haven't seen a good "teen girl" movie in so long. In fact, I don't remember the last time I went and saw a "teen girl" movie. Maybe if there were more out there was fun as this, I would. Basically, I had boring, rainy Saturday and a little sister. The trip to the theatre wound up with the two us laughing our heads off and all the appropriate "aww" moments.

The premise is a modern-day Snow White on a college campus. A little contrived, but hey, it apparently worked. Sydney is your average tomboy who is under all sorts of pressure to pledge herself to her dead mother's old sorority. Well, the sorority girls are no longer what they used to be, and the pampered princesses throw Sydney out into the rain. She winds up taking refuge at the Vortex, a student housing building where lives the guy she dumped for a sorority mission and his six bizarre roommates.

Honestly, I didn't think it would work. But it did, and besides the cuteness there is a little more moral meat as Sydney and her new friends lead a student body revolution. Yeah, it's cheesy and we've seen the revenge-of-the-nerds theme many a time before, but it's so goodhearted and fun that I couldn't help but love it, stereotypes, predictability, and all.

All the characters seemed very much into their roles. I wouldn't say I'm an Amanda Bynes fan, but she failed to annoy me this time around! It was a great blend of an old story with modern college life with clever, roll-your-eyes references to the original Disney animated film. It might bother some people, but as a Snow White fan I thought they were cute. 

It's definitely a girl movie, I'll give you that, so if you can't put up with the silliness and the cheesiness, you will not enjoy it. But if you're a girl looking for a cute movie with a lot of harmless fun, this will hit the spot. This is one I will definitely buy on DVD and watch when I need something light and fun.

Not the most artistic of film making and not a whole lot of focus on in-depth characters and originality, but as a former teenage girl, I will happily give this adorable little film 7/10 for sheer sweetness, a good heart, and a passion for doing the right thing. Sometimes we just need that girly spunk.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":47414,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.2},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Comedy","Drama","Romance"],"datePublished":"2008-04-16","keywords":"college,sorority,college girl,female protagonist,sorority house","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Sydney White","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3752919321","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTc2MzQ0NTI1OF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMTA1NjYzMzE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTc2MzQ0NTI1OF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMTA1NjYzMzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"Sydney White - Trailer"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0004789/","name":"Amanda Bynes"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0668139/","name":"Sara Paxton"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1668265/","name":"Matt Long"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0638271/","name":"Joe Nussbaum"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0033472/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0201512/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0097249/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1548657/","name":"Chad Gomez Creasey"}],"duration":"PT1H48M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Prêt-à-Porter
Prêt-à-Porter
programme.desc:
Prêt-à-Porter: Directed by Robert Altman. With Marcello Mastroianni, Sophia Loren, Jean-Pierre Cassel, Kim Basinger. A chronicle of the interconnected lives of a group of people in the lead up to Paris Fashion Week." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0110907/","name":"Prêt-à-Porter","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZWMwN2RiZDQtN2RkNS00YzJkLWI2ODMtODk1MzQxODE4NzU0XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTQxNzMzNDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"A chronicle of the interconnected lives of a group of people in the lead up to Paris Fashion Week.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0110907/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"zetes"},"dateCreated":"2001-06-07","inLanguage":"English","name":"Unfairly Maligned. Far better than people give it credit for","reviewBody":"And that's not saying that it's great either. It is not. But it's tremendously low imdb rating makes me wonder who the heck is voting here. Pret-a-Porter is a pretty good Robert Altman film that is no better or worse than Short Cuts, which, while I feel it is a good film, I also think it is overrated. This one is, however, heavily underrated, and they both got the same imdb score from me: 7/10 = 3/4 stars.

This is another attempt to make another Nashville. There's a humongous ensemble cast of actors, some of the best on the planet, a couple of the best who ever lived. The screenwriter doesn't connect it all very well, and lots of the characters seem superfluous or underdeveloped, unlike in Nashville where even the characters who are only in a couple of scenes are as familiar to the viewer as a close friend. I would particularly have liked the Danny Aiello/Teri Garr section to have been removed. It falls pretty flat. The Sophia Loren/Marcello Mastrioanni section, the section that most film buffs are going to be excited for, also plops by its end. And Kim Basinger, a good actress, truly deserving her L.A. Confidential Oscar, is not very good as the Southern U.S. reporter: her accent is difficult to get around, and her character is often annoying, too. Sometimes, though, her pieces succeed.

Many other of the vignettes succeed quite well, although there are never any fireworks about to shoot off. The Tim Robbins/Julia Roberts plot is very funny. The three publishers, Sally Kellerman, Tracy Ullman, and Linda Hunt's attempts to sign photographer Milo (Stephen Rea) to their magazine are all very humorous. The love quadrangle between the two designers, Forest Whitaker and Richard E. Grant, and their lovers is very good, also. Anouk Aimee's section is also great, maybe the best part (Rupet Everett is good, also). I loved her so much in La Dolce Vita and 8 1/2. I was aching for her and Marcello Mastrioanni to interact.

The ending is truly fantastic. It is very well directed and filmed. It's a good film.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":14872,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.2},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Comedy","Drama"],"datePublished":"1994-12-25","keywords":"public nudity,fashion,fashion show,journalist,fashion industry","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Ready to Wear","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi198221337","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZmFmZjdhMmUtYTE5OS00MDkzLTgzMjUtYWZmYzNiYTI2NjVhXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZmFmZjdhMmUtYTE5OS00MDkzLTgzMjUtYWZmYzNiYTI2NjVhXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Trailer"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000047/","name":"Sophia Loren"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000210/","name":"Julia Roberts"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000052/","name":"Marcello Mastroianni"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000265/","name":"Robert Altman"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0332748/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0022594/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000265/","name":"Robert Altman"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0795694/","name":"Barbara Shulgasser"}],"duration":"PT2H13M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Erin Brockovich
Erin Brockovich
programme.desc:
Erin Brockovich: Directed by Steven Soderbergh. With Julia Roberts, David Brisbin, Dawn Didawick, Albert Finney. An unemployed single mother becomes a legal assistant and almost single-handedly brings down a California power company accused of polluting a city's water supply." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0195685/","name":"Erin Brockovich","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYTA1NWRkNTktNDMxNS00NjE4LWEzMDAtNzA3YzlhYzRhNDA4L2ltYWdlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTQxNzMzNDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"An unemployed single mother becomes a legal assistant and almost single-handedly brings down a California power company accused of polluting a city's water supply.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0195685/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"bob the moo"},"dateCreated":"2003-02-21","inLanguage":"English","name":"Enjoyable","reviewBody":"Out of work, out of hope, trashy, twice divorced single mother Erin fails to get another job due to her lack of experience. On her way home she is hit by another car. She goes to lawyer Ed Masry who spectacularly fails to win her any damages. Erin demands he gives her a job and he begrudgingly does. Doing some of his pro-bono work, Erin uncovers evidence that suggests that manufacturing firm PG&E had poisoned the local water supply and lie to residents about the content. As she looks deeper she finds a legacy of illness and a small bit of research turns into a mammoth case.

I don't know how much of this drama is factual and how much of it is changed to add to dramatic effect but regardless the story is involving, funny and moving. At the time there was a rash of 'environmental damage' legal films of which this is one of the more polished and classy. The film focuses as much on Erin as it does on the case and at times it risked failing as a legal drama/thriller. However it still grips as the facts pretty much speak for themselves  the film adds to this by creating a real sense of PG&E as a monster without scruples or concern for the residents. As a result the events feel more powerful and involving. It feels slow at times, but if you're into it then it feels patient rather than slow and deliberate rather than laboured.

The biggest reason that the focus on Erin works is because Roberts really does very well giving her Erin a down to earth, trashy feel that could have been hammy or unbelievable (she is a multimillion pound actress after all), but it wasn't. Instead it was realistic and quite warm  where she could have been annoying. The grumpy Finney is also good value and seems natural in the role. Eckhart is almost too good to be true but gives a likable performance and is a winning non-distraction.

The film benefits from the style that Soderbergh brings to it. It glides with the grace that he brought to Ocean's 11 and has the rich colouring that parts of Traffic had. His direction really adds to the film and makes the sum feel a little greater that the parts put together.

Overall this may not be the legal thriller that you hoped for and it may move a great deal slower that I thought a Hollywood film would, but it is worth it. The film is patient and worth baring with and Roberts is actually pretty good in the lead! Enjoyable."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":185453,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.4},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Biography","Drama"],"datePublished":"2000-03-17","keywords":"environmental issue,contamination,corporate crime,single mother,contaminated water","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi440712729","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZTRhNjI2NjEtZTdhMi00ZDkxLWI4MjYtMWU2ODU0MzExMmU2XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZTRhNjI2NjEtZTdhMi00ZDkxLWI4MjYtMWU2ODU0MzExMmU2XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":""},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000210/","name":"Julia Roberts"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001215/","name":"Albert Finney"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0109773/","name":"David Brisbin"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001752/","name":"Steven Soderbergh"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0005073/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0050868/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0010434/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0335666/","name":"Susannah Grant"}],"duration":"PT2H11M"}</script><metacontent="

An unemployed single mother becomes a legal assistant and almost single-handedly brings down a California power company accused of polluting a city's water supply." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0195685/","name":"Erin Brockovich","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYTA1NWRkNTktNDMxNS00NjE4LWEzMDAtNzA3YzlhYzRhNDA4L2ltYWdlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTQxNzMzNDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"An unemployed single mother becomes a legal assistant and almost single-handedly brings down a California power company accused of polluting a city's water supply.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0195685/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"bob the moo","dateCreated":"2003-02-21","inLanguage":"English","name":"Enjoyable","reviewBody":"Out of work, out of hope, trashy, twice divorced single mother Erin fails to get another job due to her lack of experience. On her way home she is hit by another car. She goes to lawyer Ed Masry who spectacularly fails to win her any damages. Erin demands he gives her a job and he begrudgingly does. Doing some of his pro-bono work, Erin uncovers evidence that suggests that manufacturing firm PG&E had poisoned the local water supply and lie to residents about the content. As she looks deeper she finds a legacy of illness and a small bit of research turns into a mammoth case.

I don't know how much of this drama is factual and how much of it is changed to add to dramatic effect but regardless the story is involving, funny and moving. At the time there was a rash of 'environmental damage' legal films of which this is one of the more polished and classy. The film focuses as much on Erin as it does on the case and at times it risked failing as a legal drama/thriller. However it still grips as the facts pretty much speak for themselves  the film adds to this by creating a real sense of PG&E as a monster without scruples or concern for the residents. As a result the events feel more powerful and involving. It feels slow at times, but if you're into it then it feels patient rather than slow and deliberate rather than laboured.

The biggest reason that the focus on Erin works is because Roberts really does very well giving her Erin a down to earth, trashy feel that could have been hammy or unbelievable (she is a multimillion pound actress after all), but it wasn't. Instead it was realistic and quite warm  where she could have been annoying. The grumpy Finney is also good value and seems natural in the role. Eckhart is almost too good to be true but gives a likable performance and is a winning non-distraction.

The film benefits from the style that Soderbergh brings to it. It glides with the grace that he brought to Ocean's 11 and has the rich colouring that parts of Traffic had. His direction really adds to the film and makes the sum feel a little greater that the parts put together.

Overall this may not be the legal thriller that you hoped for and it may move a great deal slower that I thought a Hollywood film would, but it is worth it. programme.title: Donnie Brasco
Donnie Brasco
programme.desc:
Donnie Brasco: Directed by Mike Newell. With Al Pacino, Johnny Depp, Michael Madsen, Bruno Kirby. An FBI undercover agent infiltrates the mob and finds himself identifying more with the mafia life, at the expense of his regular one." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0119008/","name":"Donnie Brasco","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYzMzMDZkYWEtODIzNS00YjI3LTkxNTktOWEyZGM3ZWI2MWM4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzkwMjQ5NzM@._V1_.jpg","description":"An FBI undercover agent infiltrates the mob and finds himself identifying more with the mafia life, at the expense of his regular one.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0119008/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"The_Movie_Cat"},"dateCreated":"2000-07-03","inLanguage":"English","name":""Fergeddaboudid!"","reviewBody":"For a movie that's only three years old Donnie Brasco isn't something people talk about all that much. Not exactly setting the box office alight, it's further proof that great pictures don't always translate into great financial concerns. 

Maybe it's the nondescript title - "Donnie Brasco" is hardly awe-inspiring and gives little indication of what the film is about. It turns out Donnie is the undercover name for Joe Pistone (Depp), a FBI agent investigating the Mafia. He makes a connection with "Lefty" (Pacino), which, while his initial integration into the group seems to lack conviction, soon builds up a watchable father-son relationship. Criticisms of the film - such as the forced nature of Pistone's behaviour becoming absorbed into the Mafia mindset - are largely irrelevant as this is a "based on a true story" outing.

Engrossing and eminently watchable, with first-rate lead performances and able back-up from Michael Madsen, this is an overlooked and extremely worthwhile film. The only complaint? Depp's first scenes, wearing the most fake-looking moustache in the history of the movies. But it detracts little from what is a highly skilled picture. So Fergeddaboudid!","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":291411,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.7},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Biography","Crime","Drama"],"datePublished":"1997-02-28","keywords":"mafia,fbi agent,money,cutting off a leg,racial slur","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Donnie Brasco: Extended Cut","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3768189721","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOGY2M2NiY2ItMDNjMC00NDE2LWJkZjYtZTA0ZDEyODBiM2RkXkEyXkFqcGdeQWVyZ3JlZW5l._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOGY2M2NiY2ItMDNjMC00NDE2LWJkZjYtZTA0ZDEyODBiM2RkXkEyXkFqcGdeQWVyZ3JlZW5l._V1_.jpg","description":"Home Video Trailer from Sony Pictures Home Entertainment"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000199/","name":"Al Pacino"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000136/","name":"Johnny Depp"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000514/","name":"Michael Madsen"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001565/","name":"Mike Newell"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0033437/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0038108/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0013696/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0685587/","name":"Joseph D. programme.title: 8MM
8 milimetara
programme.desc:
8MM: Directed by Joel Schumacher. With Nicolas Cage, Joaquin Phoenix, James Gandolfini, Peter Stormare. A private investigator is hired to discover if a "snuff film" is authentic or not." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0134273/","name":"8MM","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNTNiMzAxZGMtZGYwZi00NWVmLTgyNmYtMGIwZGJhNzE0NmJjXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzkwMjQ5NzM@._V1_.jpg","description":"A private investigator is hired to discover if a "snuff film" is authentic or not.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0134273/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"jzappa"},"dateCreated":"2008-09-12","inLanguage":"English","name":"An Voyeuristic Thriller About Human's Capacity For Evil","reviewBody":"There is a lot to be said about skill. Joel Schumacher is responsible for Batman & Robin, one of the most horrendously made movies in the past 15 years. One could have said upon leaving the theater in 1997 that Joel Schumacher is one of the worst directors working today. Two years later, Schumacher creates something, albeit with commercial sensibilities, that succeeds on many levels. 8mm is a murky, scuzzy passage through the miserable, dystopian criminal world of snuff films, taken on by a private investigator who is dismayed and scarred by what he unearths. It probes the resources of violent exploitation films, but not as a violent exploitation film. It would more accurately turn your stomach than amuse. Andrew Kevin Walker, who wrote Seven, and again establishes a protagonist who confronts evil and nearly loses his sanity in an effort to understand its reasons. The answer comes almost at the end of the film, from its most vicious character, but his rationale wittingly refrains from going as deep as the psychological world of his deeds. Joel Schumacher has an attraction to sinister, perhaps Gothic environments, even if his previous films that follow that pattern aren't so great, like The Lost Boys. Here, with Mychael Danna's sorrowful score and the great Robert Elswit's guilty, peeping camera, he fashions an impression of apprehension even in the few scenes where the story takes solace in Cage's home life. One director would not be wrong to shock us with a comparison to the unsuspecting atmosphere of Cage's residential street or the opening airport shot, but Schumacher perceives the looming subterranean goings-on beneath the unsuspecting.

The intent of the story is to consider a rather everyday individual and provoke him into such a troubling conflict with pure evil that he himself is pushed to torture and murder. He lives an unexciting but mostly happy life with his wife Catherine Keener and their infant daughter. He went to a good school on an academic scholarship, however while his contemporaries went through the most conventional motions to become lawyers, doctors, bankers, he chose a line of work comprised of following, shadowing, investigating, staking out, watching. For the sake of a comfortable living, he accommodates an upper crust circle of socialites and politicians. Nevertheless, this case which he almost does not take is unique. He is sent for by the attorney of a rich widow whose husband has just died. Whilst rummaging through the inside of her husband's safe, she and the lawyer find an 8 mm film of what seems to be the vicious slaying of a teenage girl by a large masked man. Cage convinces himself that the film, while horrifying, is simulation, but the widow wants him to confirm this for sure.

8mm doesn't consider the story's dilemmas merely as opportunity for money-making set pieces like action scenes. When Cage has the chance to take revenge, he doesn't have the command of his motivation because he does not have the same capacity for murder that his prospective victims have, and he essentially calls a character wounded by this person and provokes her to talk him into it. That is a novel approach the protagonist's vengeful turning point, and it elicits subliminal moral uncertainty that the audience has to take in hand.

8mm is a conventional studio thriller, but it is a real movie. It is all content and the suitable approach to that content. It is about human's aptitude for malevolence, conjecturing just deep it can go and how little we care to know of it in ourselves.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":128588,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.5},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Crime","Drama","Mystery"],"datePublished":"1999-05-05","keywords":"male full frontal nudity,sexual sadism,snuff film,male frontal nudity,female full frontal nudity","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"8mm","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi4078878489","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYWZhMDc0Y2YtYTgxMi00MGRkLWEwNGMtYWE2ZGQzM2RjNDViXkEyXkFqcGdeQVRoaXJkUGFydHlJbmdlc3Rpb25Xb3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYWZhMDc0Y2YtYTgxMi00MGRkLWEwNGMtYWE2ZGQzM2RjNDViXkEyXkFqcGdeQVRoaXJkUGFydHlJbmdlc3Rpb25Xb3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Official Home Video Trailer"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000115/","name":"Nicolas Cage"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001618/","name":"Joaquin Phoenix"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001254/","name":"James Gandolfini"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001708/","name":"Joel Schumacher"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0050868/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0030084/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0012600/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001825/","name":"Andrew Kevin Walker"}],"duration":"PT2H3M"}</script><metacontent="

8mm doesn't consider the story's dilemmas merely as opportunity for money-making set pieces like action scenes. When Cage has the chance to take revenge, he doesn't have the command of his motivation because he does not have the same capacity for murder that his prospective victims have, and he essentially calls a character wounded by this person and provokes her to talk him into it. That is a novel approach the protagonist's vengeful turning point, and it elicits subliminal moral uncertainty that the audience has to take in hand.

8mm is a conventional studio thriller, but it is a real movie. It is all content and the suitable approach to that content. It is about human's aptitude for malevolence, conjecturing just deep it can go and how little we care to know of it in ourselves.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":128588,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.5,"contentRating":"R","genre":["Crime","Drama","Mystery"],"datePublished":"1999-05-05","keywords":"male full frontal nudity,sexual sadism,snuff film,male frontal nudity,female full frontal nudity","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"8mm","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi4078878489","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYWZhMDc0Y2YtYTgxMi00MGRkLWEwNGMtYWE2ZGQzM2RjNDViXkEyXkFqcGdeQVRoaXJkUGFydHlJbmdlc3Rpb25Xb3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYWZhMDc0Y2YtYTgxMi00MGRkLWEwNGMtYWE2ZGQzM2RjNDViXkEyXkFqcGdeQVRoaXJkUGFydHlJbmdlc3Rpb25Xb3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Official Home Video Trailer","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000115/","name":"Nicolas Cage","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001618/","name":"Joaquin Phoenix","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001254/","name":"James Gandolfini"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001708/","name":"Joel Schumacher"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0050868/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0030084/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0012600/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001825/","name":"Andrew Kevin Walker"],"duration":"PT2H3M"</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Dak mo mai sing
Slučajni špijun
programme.desc:
Dak mo mai sing: Directed by Teddy Chan. With Jackie Chan, Eric Tsang, Vivian Hsu, Min Kim. At a Hong Kong shopping center, Buck Yuen's (Jackie Chan's) intuition warns him. He saves a robbery's loot and gets on television, ends up in Istanbul via South Korea, and accidentally becomes a spy. Fortunately, he knows Kung Fu." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0271946/","name":"Dak mo mai sing","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMzZlYjI2YTAtMWE1MS00MDJjLWJkZTUtZjRmYTNiNDE1MTRlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNDQ0MTYzMDA@._V1_.jpg","description":"At a Hong Kong shopping center, Buck Yuen's (Jackie Chan's) intuition warns him. He saves a robbery's loot and gets on television, ends up in Istanbul via South Korea, and accidentally becomes a spy. Fortunately, he knows Kung Fu.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0271946/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"zoe_smith"},"dateCreated":"2004-01-18","inLanguage":"English","name":"Chan's 'decent film period' with international appeal","reviewBody":"I'm a big Chan fan and have watched most of his films.

This one seems to be a forerunner (except the Aussie-based ones) to his attempt to internationalize himself by appearing with Western co-actors and filming on international locations. I would say that A.S. is the better of this group of films. It has a resonable plot with more purpose than most of his other films. It also has a decent filming location in Turkey, and his co-stars also have some degree of character. We also still manage to savour some good quality stunt antics before they are about to all but disappear in Chan's most recent films of Tuxedo etc.

Worth selecting out of Chan's collection."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":17010,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.9},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Action","Comedy","Crime"],"datePublished":"2002-09-18","keywords":"slapstick comedy,standing on a roof,bath,bath house,drug dealer","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Accidental Spy","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1374592537","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BN2U3N2I1MjUtOWE4OC00MjZhLWJmZWMtZDM0ZTVhYzY1MTgwXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BN2U3N2I1MjUtOWE4OC00MjZhLWJmZWMtZDM0ZTVhYzY1MTgwXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"aka Dak miu mai shing"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000329/","name":"Jackie Chan"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0453608/","name":"Min Kim"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0874676/","name":"Eric Tsang"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0151125/","name":"Teddy Chan"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0035542/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0015592/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0033915/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0212933/","name":"Rod Dean"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0387306/","name":"Ivy Ho"}],"duration":"PT1H48M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Just Cause
Pravedan cilj
programme.desc: Just Cause: Directed by Arne Glimcher. With Sean Connery, Laurence Fishburne, Kate Capshaw, Blair Underwood. A Harvard professor is lured back into the courtroom after twenty-five years to take the case of a young black man condemned to death for the horrific murder of a child." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0113501/","name":"Just Cause","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMzNlNzEyMDEtMjM0Yi00YjNiLWI4YmItNjFjZWQ2MWUxMTZiXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjUwNzk3NDc@._V1_.jpg","description":"A Harvard professor is lured back into the courtroom after twenty-five years to take the case of a young black man condemned to death for the horrific murder of a child.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0113501/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"TBJCSKCNRRQTreviews"},"dateCreated":"2004-02-02","inLanguage":"English","name":"Just OK","reviewBody":"This movie started out as an apparently good movie, but about halfway through it started to go to hell. The only mildly good thing about the latter half of the movie was Sean Connery, who pretty much shines through the entire movie. His acting was pretty good, and could have been a saving grace, had the movie not been so bad. The end was especially horrible, as it was a nearly total ripoff of Cape Fear(the new version, with Robert De Niro), in fact, several lines were taken directly from that same scene in the movie. The second-to worst thing is the 'twist' in the end, that was so obvious that I could just as well have been sitting there, waiting for it to happen. The worst thing is that the twist ruins everything that has happened up to that point, and makes the whole movie pointless since it directly opposes nearly everything that happened in the movie before that. I wouldn't recommend this to anyone other than huge fans of Sean Connery, or people who love to watch crime mysteries. Other than that, there is no reason to waste time on this movie. 6/10","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":6}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":26069,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.4},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Action","Crime","Drama"],"datePublished":"1995-02-17","keywords":"child gagged,murder,florida,prison interview,african american","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Just Cause","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3566403865","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOWMxMmEwY2UtMDA3Zi00YmRhLWJiMmMtYjFlZjM2MTcyZDg2XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOWMxMmEwY2UtMDA3Zi00YmRhLWJiMmMtYjFlZjM2MTcyZDg2XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Trailer"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000125/","name":"Sean Connery"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000401/","name":"Laurence Fishburne"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001009/","name":"Kate Capshaw"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0322865/","name":"Arne Glimcher"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0002663/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0103746/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0033412/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0441896/","name":"John Katzenbach"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0835732/","name":"Jeb Stuart"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0832099/","name":"Peter Stone"}],"duration":"PT1H42M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.desc: Are We There Yet?: Directed by Brian Levant. With Ice Cube, Nia Long, Aleisha Allen, Philip Bolden. To impress a foxy divorcee, ladies' man Nick offers to take her kids on an extended road trip, unaware of the torture he's in for." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0368578/","name":"Are We There Yet?","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZWYwZGI3MTgtMTNiZS00ZWYyLThmYjAtMjkwZTU4M2IxNjI5XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTQxNzMzNDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"To impress a foxy divorcee, ladies' man Nick offers to take her kids on an extended road trip, unaware of the torture he's in for.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0368578/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"srmtn1"},"dateCreated":"2005-08-21","inLanguage":"English","name":"Real laughs from clean comedy and a cute story line","reviewBody":"What is up with the low ratings? This movie had us laughing all the way through it! Clean, somewhat predictable but in a fresh way. These kids did great in the movie; we enjoyed it a lot! Could easily lend itself to a sequel and another "road trip" kind of scenario. I see it as engaging and charming as "Home Alone" was so many years ago. I did think the mother's reaction at the end was a little extreme and that could have gone differently, but I didn't expect an Oscar-winning storyline with this fun, punchy, movie. I guess if there had been more swearing, sex, and violence it would have caught on better; seems to be where our culture likes to go these days. I say kudos to the writers and actors...you done good with this one and guess what...we're going to watch it again today!","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":30922,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":4.7},"contentRating":"PG","genre":["Adventure","Comedy","Family"],"datePublished":"2005-05-25","keywords":"braces,new year,children,highway travel,road movie","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Are We There Yet?","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1991704857","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYjNmMWQ4YTMtNjQ2Zi00YmRkLWE4MmYtZjlhMzc5MTRkNGRjXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYjNmMWQ4YTMtNjQ2Zi00YmRkLWE4MmYtZjlhMzc5MTRkNGRjXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Trailer"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001084/","name":"Ice Cube"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000505/","name":"Nia Long"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0020248/","name":"Aleisha Allen"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0505152/","name":"Brian Levant"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0003580/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0044714/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1027958/","name":"Steven Gary Banks"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1257282/","name":"Claudia Grazioso"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0826425/","name":"J. programme.title: Monty Python and the Holy Grail
Monty Python i Sveti gral
programme.desc:
Monty Python and the Holy Grail: Directed by Terry Gilliam, Terry Jones. With Graham Chapman, John Cleese, Eric Idle, Terry Gilliam. King Arthur and his Knights of the Round Table embark on a surreal, low-budget search for the Holy Grail, encountering many, very silly obstacles." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0071853/","name":"Monty Python and the Holy Grail","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BN2IyNTE4YzUtZWU0Mi00MGIwLTgyMmQtMzQ4YzQxYWNlYWE2XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjU0OTQ0OTY@._V1_.jpg","description":"King Arthur and his Knights of the Round Table embark on a surreal, low-budget search for the Holy Grail, encountering many, very silly obstacles.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0071853/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"vladymirror"},"dateCreated":"2003-08-27","inLanguage":"English","name":"the ultimate nonsense comedy","reviewBody":"Well, this is unquestionably one of the funniest movies ever made. The first time a saw it I laughed to tears and this is the only time that counts. The first time you get the best experience. I really envy those who haven't seen it yet. 

From the opening scene to the sudden ending this one won't let you leave the room. Especially the opening scene: "Are you trying to say that coconuts migrate" or when John Cleese trying to be Tarzan, hanging on the rope said: "Can somebody give me a push." An absolute masterpiece.

 Considering the low budget that the creators of the movie had at their disposal would probably make "The Holy Grail" the best movie in this genre-silly nonsense kind of stuff. It shows the great creativity and acting capabilities of the Monty Python crew. It comes to say that a movie can be made with a little bit of money - a great movie. 10 out of 10"},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":517753,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":8.2},"contentRating":"PG","genre":["Adventure","Comedy","Fantasy"],"datePublished":"1975-05-25","keywords":"holy grail,monty python,killer rabbit,knight,camelot","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3159408409","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNjg0NzFhY2UtNmRjMS00OGIwLTg1OTAtNjZkMDY3ZDFkZmU1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNjg0NzFhY2UtNmRjMS00OGIwLTg1OTAtNjZkMDY3ZDFkZmU1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":""},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001037/","name":"Graham Chapman"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000092/","name":"John Cleese"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001385/","name":"Eric Idle"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000416/","name":"Terry Gilliam"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001402/","name":"Terry Jones"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0103397/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0103461/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0061741/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001037/","name":"Graham Chapman"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000092/","name":"John Cleese"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001385/","name":"Eric Idle"}],"duration":"PT1H31M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: The English Patient
Engleski pacijent
programme.desc: The English Patient: Directed by Anthony Minghella. With Ralph Fiennes, Juliette Binoche, Willem Dafoe, Kristin Scott Thomas. At the close of World War II, a young nurse tends to a badly-burned plane crash victim. His past is shown in flashbacks, revealing an involvement in a fateful love affair." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0116209/","name":"The English Patient","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOTkxZTdkNTQtM2QwOS00NzRlLWEyMGItYTcxOTE4NTgyNGVhXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTQxNzMzNDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"At the close of World War II, a young nurse tends to a badly-burned plane crash victim. His past is shown in flashbacks, revealing an involvement in a fateful love affair.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0116209/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"littlemartinarocena"},"dateCreated":"2009-05-19","inLanguage":"English","name":"Anthony Minghella's Heart and Mind","reviewBody":"It is a strangely powerful and moving experience to see "The English Patient" again after Anthony Minghella's death. Most of his body of work is dedicated to one shattering point. The endless moral struggle of those who, consciously, walk a very thin line. In "The Talented Mr Ripley" Minghella moves away from Patricia Highsmith's amoral Tom Ripley to give the murderer a conscience. In "Breaking And Entering" Minghella gives Jude Law's character the need to confess and the rewards are chillingly moving. Here, in "The English Patient", the characters in love are never too far away from their corroding feeling of guilt. Ralph Finnes and Kristin Scott Thomas are extraordinary. They strip their characters from every pretense in a compelling complicity with us, the audience. Juliette Binoche is, quite simply, spectacular and her scenes with the wonderful Naveen Andrews are filled with a "Minghellian" sensual innocence. Anthony Minghella gave us films that were,one way or another, that elusive mix of art and commerce. He was true to himself but thought about his audience. He knew how to push our buttons without betraying his own. There is something clear, honest and startling about Minghella's opus. I miss him already but I'm grateful for the reflection of his soul he left behind.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":184174,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.4},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Drama","Romance","War"],"datePublished":"1996-12-06","keywords":"patient,nurse,flashback,english,church","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"The English Patient","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi561882649","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYjU5YjA1MGMtOTJlZi00MzQzLTgxYWQtZGNlNjI0NzgyZmY4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYjU5YjA1MGMtOTJlZi00MzQzLTgxYWQtZGNlNjI0NzgyZmY4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Trailer for The English Patient"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000146/","name":"Ralph Fiennes"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000300/","name":"Juliette Binoche"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000353/","name":"Willem Dafoe"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005237/","name":"Anthony Minghella"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0022594/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0034657/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0648546/","name":"Michael Ondaatje"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005237/","name":"Anthony Minghella"}],"duration":"PT2H42M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: The Covenant
Zavjet šutnje
programme.desc: The Covenant: Directed by Renny Harlin. With Steven Strait, Laura Ramsey, Sebastian Stan, Taylor Kitsch. Four young men who belong to a New England supernatural legacy are forced to battle a fifth power long thought to have died out. Meanwhile, jealousy and suspicion threaten to tear them apart." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0475944/","name":"The Covenant","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNjI1MTM1OTEwMV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwODYzNzUzMQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Four young men who belong to a New England supernatural legacy are forced to battle a fifth power long thought to have died out. Meanwhile, jealousy and suspicion threaten to tear them apart.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0475944/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"wimdall"},"dateCreated":"2006-09-08","inLanguage":"English","name":"The Idea had potential","reviewBody":"The idea of the movie was better than the movie itself, I thought. It did have potential, but didn't really embrace it as much as it should have. Basically, it's about four warlocks who are descent from four families from the 17th century who were able to harness the power of witchcraft. But when a fifth one shows up, stronger than all of them and seeking the power of the others, they must stop him before he kills them and everyone they care about. Think Underworld meets Highlander, and that's the basic mood of the movie. It's easy to think of this as an Underworld knock off, but it was actually better than that. The plot is predictable, and drags at times, and there is almost no character development. A lot of interesting subplots are touched upon, but never really explored, and the way they ended it, they obviously want sequels. Check it out, there's some pretty cool action scenes and an interesting story to back it up, but don't count on being blown away.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":48242,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.3},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Action","Adventure","Fantasy"],"datePublished":"2006-11-29","keywords":"male in a shower,magic,friendship between men,male rear nudity,supernatural power","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1711829/","name":"Steven Strait"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1659221/","name":"Sebastian Stan"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1738172/","name":"Toby Hemingway"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001317/","name":"Renny Harlin"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0010568/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0005323/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0058328/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0136592/","name":"J.S. programme.title: Superhero Movie
Film o superjunaku
programme.desc:
Superhero Movie: Directed by Craig Mazin. With Drake Bell, Sara Paxton, Christopher McDonald, Leslie Nielsen. Orphaned high school student Rick Riker is bitten by a radioactive dragonfly, develops super powers (except for the ability to fly), and becomes a hero." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0426592/","name":"Superhero Movie","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTc0Njc1MTU5Nl5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMjA4NDE2MQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Orphaned high school student Rick Riker is bitten by a radioactive dragonfly, develops super powers (except for the ability to fly), and becomes a hero.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0426592/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"atinder"},"dateCreated":"2009-07-14","inLanguage":"English","name":"Very funny","reviewBody":"With all these bad Spoof movies like Date movie, Not Another Teen Movie,Epic Movie and Disaster Movie (which is the worst spoof movie ever).

So i was thinking this will be the same, but my god, this movie made me laugh so much, This so much better then others movies listed above.

Plot: In this spoof of Hollywood blockbusters, director and screenwriter Craig Mazin (THE SPECIALS) tackles the age-old story of a regular guy who suddenly finds that he possesses super powers. Ricky Riker (Drake Bell) is a typical teenager, except that his luck is worse then most. Basically, he's a loser. He's been in love with beautiful Jill (Sara Paxton) for years, but is sure she doesn't know he exists. Even his best friend, Trey (Kevin Hart), is willing to throw him over for another clique. But Rick's life changes dramatically when a genetically enhanced dragonfly bites him during a school field trip. In a flash, he becomes the Dragonfly. He can scale buildings, and has immense strength--though he's still a klutz. Rick isn't sure he has what it takes to be a superhero, but it's up to him to save the city from the villainous Hourglass (Christopher McDonald), who literally sucks the life out of people, and threatens to harm those dearest to Rick. Mazin, The main spoof is spider man they also spoof Batman, the Fantastic Four, and the X-Men.

I love this movie , well the last spoof movie I Saw was Disaster movie, that was oh my god, that movie was SO bad ) (That is one the reason why i like this more then I Should)

The superhero movie is one of the better spoof to come out last year, I am not saying it the best spoof.

I enjoyed it!","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":66147,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":4.6},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Action","Comedy","Sci-Fi"],"datePublished":"2008-03-28","keywords":"parody,product placement,field trip,professor charles xavier character,storm character","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Superhero Movie","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi803864857","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTc4ODU1OTktY2EzZC00M2I0LWI1ZjMtMDFiODM2NzQyODI1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTc4ODU1OTktY2EzZC00M2I0LWI1ZjMtMDFiODM2NzQyODI1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Home Video Trailer from The Weinstein Company"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0068166/","name":"Drake Bell"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000558/","name":"Leslie Nielsen"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0668139/","name":"Sara Paxton"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0563301/","name":"Craig Mazin"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0019626/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0563301/","name":"Craig Mazin"}],"duration":"PT1H15M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.desc:
Wolf: Directed by Mike Nichols. With Jack Nicholson, Michelle Pfeiffer, James Spader, Kate Nelligan. Publisher Will Randall becomes a demon wolf and has to fight to keep his job." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0111742/","name":"Wolf","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjY3NTgxZGItMWU2Mi00OTQ0LTg2OGQtYWI3NzU4MTYxMTBlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTQxNzMzNDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"Publisher Will Randall becomes a demon wolf and has to fight to keep his job.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0111742/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Rammstein-2"},"dateCreated":"2000-12-04","inLanguage":"English","name":"Nicholson is a wolf... no surprise","reviewBody":"I like this film. It is different as a horror movie, because it really isn't a horror movie - and yet here we have a man turning into a wolf, he starts killing people at night, and we have the rabid horror music stalking our ears when the wolf is on the prowl.

I like the characters, I like the slow pace and the calm moments and I especially like Jack Nicholson when Randall's senses start to come alive. He is extremely well cast for this film, I don't think many others would actually convey the animal inside like he does. Pfieffer's character is, although formulaic, a relief among all the hard-assed men of this film. The ending is a bit silly, but nonetheless odd and intriguing.

Yep.I like this movie. It's fun to watch and it's great to see Nicholson act like the animal we all really think he is but don't dare to find out.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":54531,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.2},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Drama","Horror","Romance"],"datePublished":"1994-06-17","keywords":"werewolf,manhattan new york city,publisher,sense of smell,bradbury building","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Wolf","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1073611033","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYTllM2I0ZWEtMTdlOS00ZjM5LWI2NDgtZjk2NzU5ODVlZTdiXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYTllM2I0ZWEtMTdlOS00ZjM5LWI2NDgtZjk2NzU5ODVlZTdiXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Theatrical Trailer from Columbia Tristar"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000197/","name":"Jack Nicholson"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000201/","name":"Michelle Pfeiffer"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000652/","name":"James Spader"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001566/","name":"Mike Nichols"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0050868/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0365659/","name":"Jim Harrison"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0834338/","name":"Wesley Strick"}],"duration":"PT2H5M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: The Art of War
Sam protiv svih
programme.desc:
The Art of War: Directed by Christian Duguay. With Wesley Snipes, Anne Archer, Maury Chaykin, Marie Matiko. UN's secretary general uses covert operations to help diplomacy along. Shaw's called back 6 months after one such operation. He witnesses the murder of Chinese UN ambassador at UN, NYC, chases the assassin and ends up a suspect." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0160009/","name":"The Art of War","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzAyMjE2MDI3M15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTYwNTIwMzg2._V1_.jpg","description":"UN's secretary general uses covert operations to help diplomacy along. Shaw's called back 6 months after one such operation. He witnesses the murder of Chinese UN ambassador at UN, NYC, chases the assassin and ends up a suspect.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0160009/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"michaelsibley416"},"dateCreated":"2004-09-05","inLanguage":"English","name":"great film","reviewBody":"Wesley Snipes is back better than ever in "The Art Of War," a movie that is so good it deserves to be among the top ten of the summer.

There are many reasons why I enjoyed "The Art Of War." The first reason was the supporting cast. When I first saw Donald Sutherland in this movie, I knew it would be a thing of beauty. He brought great credibility as he made a good movie, that much better. Anne Archer is one actress you can always count on to give a good performance. 

"The Art Of War" turned out to be a montage of "The Fugitive" series and "Enemy Of The State." While this is the only negative thing about this film, it didn't deter me from enjoying it to my heart's content.

There are many other things about "The Art Of War" such as the high-tech wizadry and action-filled sequences that were very enjoyable. However, the best thing about this film was the storyline. "The Art Of War" had beautiful twists toward the end of the film. In addition, there are scenes in this movie that are so good they must be seen to believe they are that good."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":29456,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.7},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Action","Adventure","Crime"],"datePublished":"2000-08-25","keywords":"hero murders a woman,nude wears eyeglasses,fbi federal bureau of investigation,motor vehicle,car","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"The Art of War","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1820918041","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BN2VhZjllMDUtODkzYi00NTc0LTg0YTctMTFjNTljY2ZiYWVmXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BN2VhZjllMDUtODkzYi00NTc0LTg0YTctMTFjNTljY2ZiYWVmXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Trailer"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000648/","name":"Wesley Snipes"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000271/","name":"Anne Archer"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001999/","name":"Maury Chaykin"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0240995/","name":"Christian Duguay"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0033472/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0043393/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0078451/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0063511/","name":"Wayne Beach"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0058164/","name":"Simon Barry"}],"duration":"PT1H57M"}</script><metacontent="

He witnesses the murder of Chinese UN ambassador at UN, NYC, chases the assassin and ends up a suspect.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0160009/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"michaelsibley416","dateCreated":"2004-09-05","inLanguage":"English","name":"great film","reviewBody":"Wesley Snipes is back better than ever in "The Art Of War," a movie that is so good it deserves to be among the top ten of the summer.

There are many reasons why I enjoyed "The Art Of War." The first reason was the supporting cast. When I first saw Donald Sutherland in this movie, I knew it would be a thing of beauty. He brought great credibility as he made a good movie, that much better. Anne Archer is one actress you can always count on to give a good performance. 

"The Art Of War" turned out to be a montage of "The Fugitive" series and "Enemy Of The State." While this is the only negative thing about this film, it didn't deter me from enjoying it to my heart's content.

There are many other things about "The Art Of War" such as the high-tech wizadry and action-filled sequences that were very enjoyable. However, the best thing about this film was the storyline. "The Art Of War" had beautiful twists toward the end of the film. In addition, there are scenes in this movie that are so good they must be seen to believe they are that good.","aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":29456,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.7,"contentRating":"R","genre":["Action","Adventure","Crime"],"datePublished":"2000-08-25","keywords":"hero murders a woman,nude wears eyeglasses,fbi federal bureau of investigation,motor vehicle,car","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"The Art of War","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1820918041","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BN2VhZjllMDUtODkzYi00NTc0LTg0YTctMTFjNTljY2ZiYWVmXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BN2VhZjllMDUtODkzYi00NTc0LTg0YTctMTFjNTljY2ZiYWVmXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Trailer","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000648/","name":"Wesley Snipes","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000271/","name":"Anne Archer","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001999/","name":"Maury Chaykin"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0240995/","name":"Christian Duguay"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0033472/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0043393/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0078451/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0063511/","name":"Wayne Beach","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0058164/","name":"Simon Barry"],"duration":"PT1H57M"</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Dracula
Dracula
programme.desc:
Dracula: Directed by Francis Ford Coppola. With Gary Oldman, Winona Ryder, Anthony Hopkins, Keanu Reeves. The centuries old vampire Count Dracula comes to England to seduce his barrister Jonathan Harker's fiancée Mina Murray and inflict havoc in the foreign land." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0103874/","name":"Dracula","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNjcyMDZlMTktYTIxOC00ZWFhLWJkYzgtNWNiYjAwYTFkNjIyXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNTIzOTk5ODM@._V1_.jpg","description":"The centuries old vampire Count Dracula comes to England to seduce his barrister Jonathan Harker's fiancée Mina Murray and inflict havoc in the foreign land.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0103874/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"ccthemovieman-1"},"dateCreated":"2006-04-22","inLanguage":"English","name":"A Treat For The Eyes And Ears","reviewBody":"As is the case with many of these latter-day horror movies, this is visually stunning. This one is particularly so, with beautiful colors, wild special effects, lavish sets and a handful of pretty women, led by Winona Ryder.

It isn't all beauty; there are some horrific, bloody moments in here. I've seen the film three times and the first two times was terrifying to me in parts. The last viewing wasn't as scary, but maybe I was distracted by seeing this on DVD for the first time, which enhanced the visuals and added some nice 5.1surround sound.

At two hours and 10 minutes, it's a bit long but there are very few lulls, if any. Gary Oldham gives his normal intense performance as Dracula and it never hurts to have Anthony Hopkins in the film. 

The only negative I found was Keannu Reeves, who sounds a bit wooden in his lines. Is it my imagination, or is he a terrible actor? Maybe it's just his voice. Nonetheless, Cary Elwes, Richard Grant, Sadie Frost and Bill Campbell all give good support to this film which is a real feast for the senses.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":202890,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.4},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Horror"],"datePublished":"1992-11-13","keywords":"dracula,vampire,horror movie remake,monster sex,female vampire","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Bram Stoker's Dracula","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3978142745","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZGUxZTM4NzQtYjhiOS00ZDNkLWIyNmItMTMwMGM1NzcwNzY3XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZGUxZTM4NzQtYjhiOS00ZDNkLWIyNmItMTMwMGM1NzcwNzY3XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Trailer for Bram Stoker's Dracula"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000198/","name":"Gary Oldman"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000213/","name":"Winona Ryder"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000164/","name":"Anthony Hopkins"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000338/","name":"Francis Ford Coppola"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0020958/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0050868/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0053492/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0831290/","name":"Bram Stoker"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0366337/","name":"James V.
